intro: Ilex sideroxyloides var. portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to the island of Puerto Rico and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, dark berries. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and have a leathery texture, while its flowers are small and inconspicuous. This variety is notable for its ecological importance in supporting local wildlife and its role in the unique flora of the Caribbean.
